result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos R Barrancos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlos R Barrancos is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlos R Barrancos was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 5 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is held open for 60 days for the state to obtain information from victim.

Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
Follow allow Family Court orders.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes:
01-08-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Defendant is non-compliant with Probation conditions.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 2 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-08-16 Court order imposing 2 days of condition time.

16A 001212 
restitution ordered held open for 60 days from  09-15-15.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 2 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Impact Statement filed with the court.
AS TO COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-FOLLOW ALL FAMILY COURT ORDERS
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is held open for 60 days for the state to obtain information from victim.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called and defendant was not present.  Court issued a Bench Warrant and forfeited cash bail.  Defendant appeared at 9:45am and case recalled.
Court rescinded BW and reinstated bail. Victim left courtroom after first call and is not available now.  Court adjourns case for sentencing and admonishes defendant that he must appear on time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. Statements made by Felicia B. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. 

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing/Restitution Hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is in receipt of all the discovery.  Defense is rejecting the offer of the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Felicia B., Natalia B., Gabriella B., Carlos B., and Yadaly B., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld

15RM003788  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-27-2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FB; NB; GB; CB; and YB.

Defendant Carlos R Barrancos in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 4 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
